root_causes: Script flags missing for every subquestion (miss(B5dx4_1) ... miss(B5dx4_4)) even though question attribute NotRequired=true — missing should be allowed.
Range checks are applied unconditionally; they should only apply when a value is present (i.e. check range only when not missing).

Inconsistent handling of special codes for the DK variable B5dDKx4: the 'missing DK' check allows 97/98/99 but the mutual-exclusivity check uses only code 5. Both checks should use the same allowed set.
Mutual-exclusivity clause unnecessarily requires not miss(B5dDKx4) and then tests any(...,5) rather than simply testing any(B5dDKx4,5,97,98,99).
instructions: Do not treat missing subquestion cells as errors. Replace checks of the form 'miss(B5dx4_1) or B5dx4_1 < 0 or B5dx4_1 > 9999' with 'not miss(B5dx4_1) and (B5dx4_1 < 0 or B5dx4_1 > 9999)'. Apply this pattern for B5dx4_1..B5dx4_4.

For column 4 enforce the 'either numeric OR DK' requirement only according to the intended validation. If column 4 is required, use: ( miss(B5dx4_4) and (miss(B5dDKx4) or ~any(B5dDKx4,5,97,98,99)) ). If column 4 is not required, do not flag when both are missing.

Make DK mutual-exclusivity use the full set of allowed DK/special codes. Replace 'not miss(B5dDKx4) and any(B5dDKx4,5)' with 'any(B5dDKx4,5,97,98,99)' (together with not miss(B5dx4_4) as appropriate) so the check is consistent.
Keep the consistency check 'B5dx4_4 <= S7_4' but only evaluate it when both B5dx4_4 and S7_4 are present (i.e. 'not miss(B5dx4_4) and not miss(S7_4) and B5dx4_4 > S7_4').

root_causes: Script flags missing for every subquestion (miss(B5dx5_1) ... miss(B5dx5_4)) even though question attribute NotRequired=true — missing should be allowed.
Range checks are applied unconditionally; they should only apply when a value is present (i.e. check range only when not missing).
Inconsistent handling of special codes for the DK variable B5dDKx5: the 'missing DK' check allows 97/98/99 but the mutual-exclusivity check uses only code 5.
Mutual-exclusivity clause uses any(B5dDKx5,5) instead of including special codes (97/98/99).
instructions: Do not treat missing subquestion cells as errors. Replace unconditional 'miss(...) or value out of range' checks with conditional ones: 'not miss(B5dx5_n) and (B5dx5_n < 0 or B5dx5_n > 9999)' for n=1..4.

For column 5 enforce 'either numeric OR DK' only when the validation requires it. If required, use: ( miss(B5dx5_4) and (miss(B5dDKx5) or ~any(B5dDKx5,5,97,98,99)) ). If not required, allow both to be missing.
Make DK mutual-exclusivity checks consistent by using the full allowed DK/special set: any(B5dDKx5,5,97,98,99) when testing for simultaneous numeric and DK answers.
Retain the consistency check comparing B5dx5_4 to S7_5 but evaluate it only when both are present (i.e. 'not miss(B5dx5_4) and not miss(S7_5) and B5dx5_4 > S7_5').
